intro: Phaulopsis inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal phaulopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
